content.description: On the face to the right of "Overbight" is this short route. Climb up to a narrow ledge, and exit the smooth face above, protected by 1 bolt.
content.protection: 0.75 Camalot to protect the move to the solitary bolt.
content.location: On the north-facing wall to the right of Overbight at the top of Poodle Wall.

content.description: A few quick and thin pulls will get you going on this slick puppy.  Easier if you are tall to grab the opening holds. Once you get going the climbing is pretty moderate on good holds all the way to the anchor.
content.protection: 8 or more bolts to Mussy Hooks
content.location: Starts just left of Poodle Bites on some slick and polished rock.  Starting point is off a small pinnacle.

content.description: Very different climbing than most Alabama Hills routes and quite fun.
content.location: Furthest right on the wall - can't miss it

content.description: A thin crack that starts above a lone bolt to the right of Poodle Bites. Â Shares the same piton anchor as Poodle Bites.
content.protection: 1 bolt, gear to 1".  Face to Crack.  Lower off
content.location: Located in between Poodle Bites and Poodle Chews it.

content.description:
Fun, easy romp on pretty good rock.

Starting from the right and bypassing the first bolt (as shown in the Bishop Area Rock Climb book) is 5.8. Direct start looked ~10a.

After passing the first bolt, climbing eases. A bit of a run on big holds to the 3/4 bolt.
content.protection:
7 bolts

anchor: two drilled pins, one with a biner, one with quicklink and chain
content.location: 2nd route from the left on the taller section of the wall.

content.description: This route starts at the top of "The Poodle Bites" and in fact the first bolt of this route can (with a long sling) be used to back up the drilled angle anchors at the top of that route.  No big deal, the route ascends the arete, passing three bolts, to the summit of the formation, where  a 2 bolt anchor will be found. Walk off the backside.
content.location: Start from the anchors at the top of "The Poodle Bites" and climb the arete to the top.  Alternately, one can scramble up the gullys to the right of Poodle Wall to reach the top of "Bites" and the base of this route.

content.description: Scramble onto a large round boulder and clip the first bolt. Pinch and undercling the downward jutting flake while smearing small nubbins to reach a seam and nice edges on the face above. Continue climbing up the shallow crack on features on either side of the crack to a stance on large patina flakes. Above a thin face leads to a move over the overlap and wonderful featured face climbing to the anchor.
content.protection: 9 bolts to shared Mussy anchors with Poodles Are People Too.
content.location: Left most route on the Puddle Wall. Twenty feet left of Poodles Are People Too.
